description: Reading passages organized by level for comprehension practice

beginner.title: My Day
paragraphs: I wake up at 7 o'clock. I eat breakfast with my family.
I go to school at 8 o'clock. I study English and Math.
I come home at 3 o'clock. I play with my friends.
I eat dinner at 6 o'clock. I go to bed at 9 o'clock.
englishParagraphs: I wake up at 7 o'clock. I eat breakfast with my family.
I go to school at 8 o'clock. I study English and Math.
I come home at 3 o'clock. I play with my friends.
I eat dinner at 6 o'clock. I go to bed at 9 o'clock.

vocabulary.english: the first meal of the day

questions.question: What time does the person wake up?

beginner.title: The Pet Shop
paragraphs: Sarah goes to the pet shop. She sees many animals.
There are dogs, cats, and birds. Sarah likes the dogs.
She wants a small brown dog. It is very cute.
Sarah is happy. She takes the dog home.
englishParagraphs: Sarah goes to the pet shop. She sees many animals.
There are dogs, cats, and birds. Sarah likes the dogs.
She wants a small brown dog. It is very cute.
Sarah is happy. She takes the dog home.

beginner.title: My Family
paragraphs: My name is Tom. I have a big family.
My father is a doctor. My mother is a teacher.
I have one sister. Her name is Anna.
We live in a house with a garden. I love my family.
englishParagraphs: My name is Tom. I have a big family.
My father is a doctor. My mother is a teacher.
I have one sister. Her name is Anna.
We live in a house with a garden. I love my family.

elementary.title: A Trip to the Beach
paragraphs: Last weekend, my family went to the beach. We left home at 8 in the morning.
The beach was beautiful. The water was blue and warm. We swam in the sea.
I built a sandcastle with my sister. My father took many photos.
We ate lunch at a restaurant near the beach. The food was delicious.
We came home at 6 in the evening. I was tired but very happy.
englishParagraphs: Last weekend, my family went to the beach. We left home at 8 in the morning.
The beach was beautiful. The water was blue and warm. We swam in the sea.
I built a sandcastle with my sister. My father took many photos.
We ate lunch at a restaurant near the beach. The food was delicious.
We came home at 6 in the evening. I was tired but very happy.

vocabulary.english: a model castle made of sand

questions.question: When did the family go to the beach?

elementary.title: Shopping for Clothes
paragraphs: Mary needs new clothes for school. She goes to the shopping mall with her mother.
First, they look at shirts. Mary likes a blue shirt. It costs $15.
Then they find some pants. The black pants are nice. They are $20.
Mary also buys new shoes. The shoes are white and comfortable.
Mary is happy with her new clothes. She thanks her mother.
englishParagraphs: Mary needs new clothes for school. She goes to the shopping mall with her mother.
First, they look at shirts. Mary likes a blue shirt. It costs $15.
Then they find some pants. The black pants are nice. They are $20.
Mary also buys new shoes. The shoes are white and comfortable.
Mary is happy with her new clothes. She thanks her mother.

vocabulary.english: a large building with many shops

questions.question: How much does the blue shirt cost?

intermediate.title: The Benefits of Exercise
paragraphs: Regular exercise is one of the most important things you can do for your health. It has many benefits for both your body and mind.
Physical activity helps control your weight and reduces the risk of heart disease. It also strengthens your bones and muscles.
Exercise is also good for your mental health. It can reduce feelings of depression and anxiety, and improve your mood.
Experts recommend at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week. This can include walking, swimming, or cycling.
Starting an exercise routine can be challenging, but the benefits are worth the effort. Even small amounts of physical activity can make a difference.
englishParagraphs: Regular exercise is one of the most important things you can do for your health. It has many benefits for both your body and mind.
Physical activity helps control your weight and reduces the risk of heart disease. It also strengthens your bones and muscles.
Exercise is also good for your mental health. It can reduce feelings of depression and anxiety, and improve your mood.
Experts recommend at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week. This can include walking, swimming, or cycling.
Starting an exercise routine can be challenging, but the benefits are worth the effort. Even small amounts of physical activity can make a difference.

questions.question: How much exercise per week do experts recommend?

advanced.title: The Future of Artificial Intelligence
paragraphs: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming virtually every sector of the economy. From healthcare to finance, AI systems are becoming increasingly sophisticated and prevalent.
One of the most significant developments has been in machine learning, where algorithms can improve their performance through experience without being explicitly programmed.
However, this rapid advancement raises important ethical questions. Issues such as job displacement, privacy concerns, and algorithmic bias require careful consideration.
Experts debate the timeline for achieving artificial general intelligence (AGI) – AI that can perform any intellectual task that a human can do.
Regardless of when AGI arrives, the impact of current AI technologies will continue to grow. Societies must develop appropriate governance frameworks.
englishParagraphs: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming virtually every sector of the economy. From healthcare to finance, AI systems are becoming increasingly sophisticated and prevalent.
One of the most significant developments has been in machine learning, where algorithms can improve their performance through experience without being explicitly programmed.
However, this rapid advancement raises important ethical questions. Issues such as job displacement, privacy concerns, and algorithmic bias require careful consideration.
Experts debate the timeline for achieving artificial general intelligence (AGI) – AI that can perform any intellectual task that a human can do.
Regardless of when AGI arrives, the impact of current AI technologies will continue to grow. Societies must develop appropriate governance frameworks.

vocabulary.english: the act of governing or controlling

proficient.title: The Paradox of Choice
paragraphs: In contemporary consumer societies, we are confronted with an unprecedented array of choices in virtually every domain of life.
Conventional wisdom suggests that more choice is invariably beneficial – it enhances autonomy and enables individuals to find options that precisely match their preferences.
The 'paradox of choice' refers to the counterintuitive finding that an abundance of options can actually undermine well-being.
Several psychological mechanisms contribute to this paradox. These include opportunity costs, escalated expectations, and self-blame for poor outcomes.
Understanding this phenomenon has practical implications for how organizations design choice architectures and how individuals navigate decision-making.
englishParagraphs: In contemporary consumer societies, we are confronted with an unprecedented array of choices in virtually every domain of life.
Conventional wisdom suggests that more choice is invariably beneficial – it enhances autonomy and enables individuals to find options that precisely match their preferences.
The 'paradox of choice' refers to the counterintuitive finding that an abundance of options can actually undermine well-being.
Several psychological mechanisms contribute to this paradox. These include opportunity costs, escalated expectations, and self-blame for poor outcomes.
Understanding this phenomenon has practical implications for how organizations design choice architectures and how individuals navigate decision-making.

questions.question: What is the main idea of the 'paradox of choice'?
options: More choices always lead to better decisions
Having too many options can reduce well-being
questions.correctAnswer: Having too many options can reduce well-being
